result.execSummary:
The defendant Shevez J. Peoples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Modification to previous finding on 10-04-2017-Release without additional payment. $100 payments to start 12-01-2017

Cases called @ 1:09 p.m. Defendant Shevez J. Peoples in court, in custody, appears via video.  Ruth Zouski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant owes in exess of $1000 and has not made a single payment on a payment plan. Atty Zouski - DE has been previously found in contempt and has served the 30 day contempt sentence. The Court finds contempt. Court orders: 90 days WC Jail - Stayed - Purge conditions: Initial payment of $100 for release from custody then $100 monthly starting December 1, 2017 until paid in full.

1:06 pm cases called. Defendant Shevez J. Peoples in court, in custody, appears via video.  Ruth Ann Zouski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by defendant-requests to be released from jail. Court lifts stay of contempt and makes statement. Defendant to serve 30 day contempt sentence, forthwith. Court states the defendant can avoid sitting the contempt sentence upon payment of the $996.00.

Case called @ 1:08 p.m. Defendant Shevez J. Peoples in court with attorney Britteny Mae LaFond.  Defendant Shevez J. Peoples in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: 48 days WCJ - 36 days CFTS - Time served sentence, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
